metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7905 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The read_gab2_sub function in libavformat/avidec.c in FFmpeg before 3.1.4allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer used)via a crafted AVI file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.1.4-1
libav-tools - 7:3.1.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.1.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.1.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.1.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.1.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.1.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.1.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.1.4-1').
